did.unittitle: Detroit, Mackinac & Marquette Land Company records 1879-1919
did.abstract: Successor to the Land Department of the Detroit, Mackinac & Marquette Railroad Company, owner of large land holdings in Michigan's Upper Peninsula. Timber surveys, applications to purchase company lands, and tax records.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records were donated in 1944 by George P. McCallum (donor 1866), the president of the company.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Detroit, Mackinac & Marquette Land Company records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Detroit, Mackinac and Marquette Railroad Company was established in 1879 to connect the Straits of Mackinac by rail with the iron mining region of Marquette County, Michigan. Through acts of 1873, 1874, 1875, 1877, and 1879, the state legislature had granted over 1,300,000 acres of state swamp lands to support the building of the railroad. The railroad was completed in 1881, but the line was not profitable, and the company was bankrupt by 1886. At that time, the land owned by the company was separated from the railroad. The railroad was consolidated into the Duluth, South Shore & Atlantic Railroad, while the land was held by a firm continuing the name Detroit, Mackinac and Marquette Railroad Company. The company continued in business under this name, as a land company, not a railroad, until 1913, when it was succeeded by the Detroit, Mackinac and Marquette Land Company. The land company remained in business until at least the early 1950s.

scopecontent.p: The record group consists of three kinds of record volumes: Timber surveys; Applications; and Tax books.

Timber survey (v. 1-32): This is a series of surveys of lumber on company-owned land in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. These surveys show estimates of how much lumber of each type of tree appears on a given quarter section of land and the type of soil that appears there. Although most of this survey work was done in the years between 1890 and 1900, some was done as late as 1919.
Applications (v. 33-40): These records show all of the applications of individuals to buy land from the railroad between 1879 and 1913

The Tax books (v. 41-45) show all of the taxes paid by the railroad on these lands between 1898 and 1915. These records are especially important because the financial problems caused by the inability to dispose of its land quickly enough led to the eventual takeover of this railroad by the Duluth, South Shore & Atlantic Railroad.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: A 1943 catalog of company lands is found in Lands and Timber owned by Detroit, Mackinac and Marquette Land Company (FB2/DM159/L263).
The papers of George P. McCallum, president of the company in the 1920s-1940s, contain some information about the company.
